definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Hitchcock also got a perverse thrill out of taking audiences on a voyeuristic roller-coaster ride.
sentences.chinese: 希區柯克也有有害刺激的考慮受衆的偷窺過山車旅程。

sentences.english: Through experimental test the safe wind velocity range of crosswind of roller coaster was obtained.
sentences.chinese: 通過實驗研究，獲得了過山車安全的橫風風速範圍。

sentences.english: A lack of identity outside your business produces a "roller coaster" effect.
sentences.chinese: 對你的事業缺乏自我認同就會產生“過山車”效應。

sentences.english: What's with that stomach-in-your-throat feeling on roller coasters?
sentences.chinese: 做過山車時爲什麼有胃到喉嚨眼的感覺？

sentences.english: There are many exciting roller-coasters in the world, Top Thrill Dragster, Steel Dragon 2000, Colossus, Superman the Escape, Incredible Hulk and Son of the Beast to name a few.
sentences.chinese: 世界上有很多令人興奮的過山車。
過山車總是在不斷刷新記錄。

sentences.english: Stock prices took a roller-coaster ride this week- down one day, up the next.
sentences.chinese: 這個星期，股價像過山車一樣，今天漲明天跌。

sentences.english: Play the 2,125,000 vehicles, roller coaster, Ferris wheel, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 玩了碰碰車，過山車，摩天輪等。

sentences.english: I felt I was in a digital roller coaster.
sentences.chinese: 那時我覺得自己坐在數字過山車上。

sentences.english: Julie-Ann said it was really going brilliantly. She said it was like a rollercoaster ride.
sentences.chinese: 朱利安說一切真是太美妙了，感覺就像在做過山車“。

sentences.english: Vanish roller coaster at Cosmo Land in Japan unexpectedly dives into an underwater tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 日本大世界過山車會出其不意的駛進水下隧道里。

sentences.english: The shadow of a wood coaster is always a nice place to have a leftover pizza picnic.
sentences.chinese: 木質過山車像樹林般的遮蔽下，是匹薩野餐的好地方。

sentences.english: My heart was in my mouth when I reached the top of the  roller coaster.
sentences.chinese: 過山車到達最高點的時候，我的心都提到嗓子眼兒了。

sentences.english: And you'll learn to climb off your own roller coaster of shame and adulation.
sentences.chinese: 而且你會學走下自己的”羞辱和奉承“的過山車。

sentences.english: My life has always been that roller coaster of ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 我的生活一直像坐過山車似的跌宕起伏。

sentences.english: It always becomes a rollercoaster of emotions.
sentences.chinese: 這就往往變成了情緒的過山車。

definition: shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
